content:
• Monday, April 8, 2013
  • MG

    More on Mistras Group (NYSE:MG): FQ3 comes in mixed, beating on revenue but coming up short on a...

    More on Mistras Group (NYSE:MG): FQ3 comes in mixed, beating on revenue but coming up short on a per share basis. Net earnings fell 9.4% Y/Y on higher overall costs. The company also cut its full-year guidance to a range of $75M to $80M, down from its January forecast of $78M to $85M, citing a challengin business and economic environment. Shares -6% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:32 PM
  • SHLM

    More on Schulman (NASDAQ:SHLM): FQ2 misses on both counts despite a 5.5% increase in total...

    More on Schulman (NASDAQ:SHLM): FQ2 misses on both counts despite a 5.5% increase in total sales. Net earnings rose 30% Y/Y, boosted by a tax benefit, though the company says it continues to restructure in Europe to address weakening market trends, and was initiating further consolidation efforts in Brazil. Due to weakening trends, the company is lowering its per-share earnings estimate to between $2.08 to $2.13 from previous estimates of $2.14 to $2.19. Shares -6% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:48 PM
  • JCP

    J.C. Penney (NYSE:JCP) confirms Ron Johnson is "stepping down and leaving the company." Mike...

    J.C. Penney (NYSE:JCP) confirms Ron Johnson is "stepping down and leaving the company." Mike Ullman, who was J.C. Penney's CEO until Nov. 2011, is replacing Johnson as CEO, and has also been elected to the company's board. Investors don't seem crazy about the choice, JCP now just +0.5% AH. (previous) Update (5:33): Shares are now down 4.4% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:26 PM | 32 Comments
  • OCZ

    OCZ Technology (NASDAQ:OCZ) -11.1% AH after announcing it won't meet the NASDAQ's April 8...

    OCZ Technology (NASDAQ:OCZ) -11.1% AH after announcing it won't meet the NASDAQ's April 8 extension date to become current with its SEC filings. Though OCZ insists it has "made substantial progress" in restating results, the company's filings for the Aug. and Nov. 2012 quarters (FQ2 and FQ3) will be further delayed. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:20 PM | 3 Comments
  • TTEK

    Tetra Tech (NASDAQ:TTEK) -3.4% AH after warning it expects weaker operating performance during...

    Tetra Tech (NASDAQ:TTEK) -3.4% AH after warning it expects weaker operating performance during its fiscal H2 2013, blaming poor economic conditions in eastern Canada. TTEK reaffirms prior FQ2 guidance of $0.38-$0.42 EPS vs. $0.41 consensus and $500M-$550M revenues vs. $533M consensus.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:07 PM
  • JCP

    J.C. Penney (NYSE:JCP) now up 6.8% AH as CNBC reports Ron Johnson is out as CEO.

    J.C. Penney (NYSE:JCP) now up 6.8% AH as CNBC reports Ron Johnson is out as CEO.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:06 PM | 7 Comments
  • STAA

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: STAA +13%. JCP +12%. HIMX +2%. GLUU +1%. EBR +1%....

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: STAA +13%. JCP +12%. HIMX +2%. GLUU +1%. EBR +1%.
    After-hours top losers: CWH -3%. CUZ -3%. SHLM -3%. STWD -3%. CECO -2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:00 PM | 1 Comment
  • STAA

    STAAR Surgical (NASDAQ:STAA) gives a preliminary Q1 revenue forecast above Street estimates,...

    STAAR Surgical (NASDAQ:STAA) gives a preliminary Q1 revenue forecast above Street estimates, saying it expects to earn approximately $18M for the quarter, beating consensus expectations of $16.6M, and representing approximately 16% growth Y/Y. Foreign currency impacted total revenue by approximately $750K during the period, while Visian ICL revenue grew approximately 24%, exceeding $10M quarterly for the first time. Results are expected to be released on May 1. Shares +13.5% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:57 PM
  • AIG

    Fans of round numbers and AIG will be pleased the insurer rose 3.8% to $40.09 today, a new...

    Fans of round numbers and AIG will be pleased the insurer rose 3.8% to $40.09 today, a new 52-week high and cracking $40 for the first time in more than 2 years. The TARP warrants - struck at $45 and expiring in 2021 - poured it on as well, +5.8% to $16.45.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:28 PM | 4 Comments
  • CPST

    Capstone Turbine (CPST +7.5%) gets a lift today after saying it's received an order for 34...

    Capstone Turbine (CPST +7.5%) gets a lift today after saying it's received an order for 34 liquid fuel C30s for use in DesignLine's Eco Saver IV range extended electric buses. The buses are expected to be delivered to Denver Regional Transportation District later this year.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:12 PM | 9 Comments
  • MG

    Mistras Group (NYSE:MG): FQ3 EPS of $0.07 misses by $0.1. Revenue of $133.7M beats by $2.08M....

    Mistras Group (NYSE:MG): FQ3 EPS of $0.07 misses by $0.1. Revenue of $133.7M beats by $2.08M. Shares -6.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:03 PM
  • EXK

    Endeavour Silver (EXK -2.7%) says it set new records for silver and gold production in its Q1,...

    Endeavour Silver (EXK -2.7%) says it set new records for silver and gold production in its Q1, but warns that some lost production days are anticipated in Q2 during the re-commissioning of the El Cubo plant in Guanajuato State.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM
  • BA

    While Boeing (BA +0.7%) continues to work with the FAA to gain clearance on its Dreamliner...

    While Boeing (BA +0.7%) continues to work with the FAA to gain clearance on its Dreamliner battery fix, United Continental (UAL +2.8%) says it expects to start running some flights of the 787 sooner than expected. The airline plans to restart some flights in Chicago by May 31st, while its Houston-Heathrow and Denver-Tokyo international flights are targeted to resume on June 10, though no specific flights were named.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:55 PM | 2 Comments
  • IEP

    There's value to be found in Icahn Enterprises (IEP +11%), Carl Icahn's publicly traded MLP...

    There's value to be found in Icahn Enterprises (IEP +11%), Carl Icahn's publicly traded MLP which has earned nearly 20% annually over the past decade, Barron's says in a weekend article. At $55, the units trade at a discount to the $64 sum-of-the-parts value and yield 7%, reflecting a recently initiated $4/share annual payout. IEP’s largest holding is an 82% stake, worth $3.6B, in CVR Energy (CVI +0.3%).
     
     
     
     
    | 3:48 PM | 2 Comments
  • GE

    Also enjoying a boost from GE's purchase of Lufkin (NASDAQ:LUFK) are small- and mid-cap makers...

    Also enjoying a boost from GE's purchase of Lufkin (NASDAQ:LUFK) are small- and mid-cap makers of drilling and production equipment for use in deepwater and other harsh environments. GE has paid "strikingly high multiples relative to the risks," Wells Fargo says, possibly sparking an upward revaluation" of names such as Dril-Quip (DRQ +1.7%), Dresser-Rand (DRC +3.5%) and Oceaneering (OII +2.6%).

     
     
     
     
    | 3:31 PM | 1 Comment
  • BCRX

    JMP Securities analyst Lisa Bayko says the rally in BioCryst Pharma (BCRX +10%) on the...

    JMP Securities analyst Lisa Bayko says the rally in BioCryst Pharma (BCRX +10%) on the China/Permivir news is overdone. She points out that BCRX has no patent in China for Peramivir, hasn't been involved in any drug approval, and "won't receive economics from use there." BCRX appears to agree. saying it doesn't even have a partner or any in-country operations in the region. TheStreet.com's Adam Fuerstein quips that the drug developer "isn't likely to see a dime" from drug sales there.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:30 PM
  • GE

    GE's "stunning" $3.3B purchase price for Lufkin (LUFK +37.5%) means Weatherford's (WFT +3.5%)...

    GE's "stunning" $3.3B purchase price for Lufkin (LUFK +37.5%) means Weatherford's (WFT +3.5%) similar business could be worth even more, given its size and global scale, Cowen says. Credit Suisse says the deal reflects the increasing importance of artificial-lift technology as firms pursue oil using unconventional methods. Dover (DOV +1.5%), a third company in the sector, also is up.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:19 PM
  • ADEP

    Adept Technology (ADEP -1.5%) says it is developing a new line of PLC programmable robots, which...

    Adept Technology (ADEP -1.5%) says it is developing a new line of PLC programmable robots, which will include new versions of the company's Cobra, Quattro, and Viper devices. The robots will interface directly with customer's existing PLC controllers including controllers manufactured by Allen Bradley and Siemens. Using the customer's existing PLC controllers allows operators to deploy the robots without the need to learn a new programming language.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:11 PM
  • FXY

    A renewed surge in the dollar vs. the yen (FXY -1.5%) , is leading/following/coincident to the...

    A renewed surge in the dollar vs. the yen (FXY -1.5%) , is leading/following/coincident to the rebound in stocks this afternoon. Now buying ¥99.25, the dollar is poised to crack ¥100 for the first time since April 2009. Vince Cignarella suggests chart watchers (who comprise the vast majority of fx traders) are eying the ¥99.75 level.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:38 PM
  • QLIK

    Qlik (QLIK +3%) trades higher as its annual partner summit gets underway. The business...

    Qlik (QLIK +3%) trades higher as its annual partner summit gets underway. The business intelligence/analytics software firm announced today nearly 1K partners out of a total of 1.5K are attending, and notes it derived 54% of its 2012 software license and first-year maintenance billings from partners. Shares rallied in February following a Q4 beat.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:28 PM
  • AMD

    AMD (AMD +4.8%) rallies after Bloomberg becomes the 8th or 9th source (give or take a few) to...

    AMD (AMD +4.8%) rallies after Bloomberg becomes the 8th or 9th source (give or take a few) to report the next-gen Xbox will use an AMD system-on-chip (SoC). In-line with prior reports, sources tell the news service the SoC will feature AMD Jaguar CPU cores to go with a GPU. A January spec leak suggests the use of 8 Jaguar cores clocked at 1.6 GHz, and an 800 MHz. GPU. The PS4 will also use an AMD SoC containing an 8-core Jaguar CPU. The Verge recently reported the next Xbox will be unveiled on May 21.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:20 PM | 6 Comments
  • CVM

    CEL-SCI Corporation (CVM -2.5%) isn't getting much of a lift today, despite its announcement...

    CEL-SCI Corporation (CVM -2.5%) isn't getting much of a lift today, despite its announcement that collaborators at the National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases have submitted for publication the results from efficacy studies in animals using CVM's H1N1 activated dendritic cells to treat the H1N1 bird flu virus. This work may possibly also be applicable to the new H7N9 bird flu strain currently detected in China, but no definitive statement has yet been made to that effect.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:14 PM
  • EPL

    EPL Oil & Gas (EPL +7.5%) is upgraded to Strong Buy with a $38 price target, up from $32, by...

    EPL Oil & Gas (EPL +7.5%) is upgraded to Strong Buy with a $38 price target, up from $32, by Capital One, which says EPL "provides investors with an attractive combination of financial discipline, solid oil-production growth and free-cash-flow generation in addition to an established history of hitting its production guidance targets."

     
     
     
     
    | 2:03 PM
  • IMMU

    Immunomedics (IMMU -2.3%) says recent data presented at the 2013 Annual Meeting of the American...

    Immunomedics (IMMU -2.3%) says recent data presented at the 2013 Annual Meeting of the American Association for Cancer Research shows its Clivatuzumab-based blood test successfully identifies the difference between patients with pancreatic cancer and chronic pancreatitis. The study showed that test, which looks for a positive indication to indentify those who may have cancer, correctly identified two thirds of patients with early stages of the disease.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:41 PM
  • NGVC

    Natural Grocers (NGVC +6.3%) moves higher on above average volume after a high-visibility story...

    Natural Grocers (NGVC +6.3%) moves higher on above average volume after a high-visibility story at TheStreet.com dubbed the company Whole Food's (WFM -1%) first "real competitor." One caveat for investors: NGVC trades at a far higher forward earnings multiple than WFM. 
     
     
     
     
    | 1:19 PM
  • JNJ

    Johnson & Johnson's (JNJ -1.6%) slips today on a downgrade to Neutral at JPMorgan, saying...

    Johnson & Johnson's (JNJ -1.6%) slips today on a downgrade to Neutral at JPMorgan, saying the stock has reached a "trading premium." Last June, JP notes, the stock was trading at a 5% discount to the "sum-of-its-parts." Now, after a 30% run, the shares trade at an 8% premium, and despite an improvement in the fundamentals, the stock is poised to plateau, at least over the near term. The firm did however, ratchet-up its price target to $83 from $77.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:02 PM
  • VHC

    VirnetX (VHC +9.4%) surges after stating it has identified another developing specification for...

    VirnetX (VHC +9.4%) surges after stating it has identified another developing specification for 4G core networks for which its patents/applications "are or may become essential." Altogether, VirnetX says it has identified 18 such specifications or developing specifications. Shares fell 7% on Friday in the absence of major news. (PR) (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:49 PM
  • OXY

    Occidental Petroleum (OXY -1.7%) denies a "fight at the top" over a successor for CEO Stephen...

    Occidental Petroleum (OXY -1.7%) denies a "fight at the top" over a successor for CEO Stephen Chazen, after recent reports that Chairman Ray Irani is pushing to replace Chazen. "All decisions regarding CEO succession planning were made over many meetings by the independent directors alone," OXY's board says. Irani "did not attend, and did not play any role in, these meeting deliberations."

     
     
     
     
    | 12:48 PM
  • SFD

    Meat stocks stumble a bit with a new report tying consumption of red meat to heart disease...

    Meat stocks stumble a bit with a new report tying consumption of red meat to heart disease getting some discussion. Decliners: Smithfield Foods (NYSE:SFD) -2.8%, Tyson Foods (NYSE:TSN) -2.2%, Hormel Foods HRL -0.5%, Sanderson Farms (NASDAQ:SAFM) -0.8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:31 PM | 2 Comments
  • VRTX

    Vertex Pharmaceuticals (VRTX -3.6%) slips today on a tepid start from Canaccord with a Hold...

    Vertex Pharmaceuticals (VRTX -3.6%) slips today on a tepid start from Canaccord with a Hold rating and modest $55 price target. The firm says its key value driver is its VX-809/Kalydeco combination therapy for cystic fibrosis, for which Phase 3 data is due out in 2014, but the the near-term focus is on top-line Phase 2 data for VX-661/Kalydeco, which is due out in Q2 and may show only modest improvements.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:31 PM
  • PVAC

    Penn Virginia (PVA -8.3%) plunges after Stifel Nicolaus cuts its rating to Hold from Buy, citing...

    Penn Virginia (PVA -8.3%) plunges after Stifel Nicolaus cuts its rating to Hold from Buy, citing last week's $400M deal for property and wells in the Eagle Ford shale in Texas which gives PVA a more levered balance sheet. There's also not enough upside in PVA's stock price to justify the risk profile and near-term possibility it could move lower depending on how the purchase is financed.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:28 PM | 1 Comment
  • PAA

    Plains All American Pipeline (PAA +1.8%) boosts its quarterly cash distribution by 2.2% Q/Q to...

    Plains All American Pipeline (PAA +1.8%) boosts its quarterly cash distribution by 2.2% Q/Q to 57.5 cents/unit, to be paid May 15 to unitholders of record as of May 3.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:08 PM
  • PRSN

    BSD Medical (BSDM +21%) gets a big boost today on the heels of it's announcement of a long term,...

    BSD Medical (BSDM +21%) gets a big boost today on the heels of it's announcement of a long term, exclusive deal with Tokyo's Terumo (OTCPK:TRUMF) Europe to provide its MicroThermX ablation system to 100 countries in Europe, Western Asia and North Africa. The agreement opens a potential $1B+ market for MicroThermX, which is used to treat a variety of cancers.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:02 PM

  • Bayer (BAYRY +2.2%) gains after saying earlier this morning its New Drug Application for...

    Bayer (BAYRY +2.2%) gains after saying earlier this morning its New Drug Application for riociguat has been granted priority review by the FDA for the treatment of two forms of pulmonary hypertension. The FDA grants priority reviews to medicines that provide a treatment where little or no adequate therapy exists.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:44 AM
  • KZIA

    Novogen (NVGN +24.4%) is higher today after following up on the pre-clinical success of its CS-6...

    Novogen (NVGN +24.4%) is higher today after following up on the pre-clinical success of its CS-6 cancer compound by initiating the manufacture of pure left- and right-hand enantiomers. The company says purifying the enantiomers may enhance the compound's potency and notes it is "now positioned to rapidly progress CS-6 to the clinic." NVGN also presented a development plan for which it hopes to raise $10M. 

     
     
     
     
    | 11:40 AM
  • SSNI

    Silver Spring (SSNI -2.3%) falls after receiving 4 bullish and 3 neutral ratings on underwriter...

    Silver Spring (SSNI -2.3%) falls after receiving 4 bullish and 3 neutral ratings on underwriter coverage day. Goldman (Neutral) forecasts a 22% billings CAGR from 2012-2015 on the back of strong smart grid demand, but also expresses concerns about lumpy deployments and regulatory/legal uncertainty. Credit Suisse (Outperform) notes Silver Spring has a 32% U.S. smart grid networking share, and praises the company for focusing on "the highest-growth and most value-add parts of the market." Shares are now up just 10% from their IPO price of $17. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:37 AM
  • TALO

    Stone Energy (SGY +1.6%) says production guidance for Q1 remains within 230M-240M cfe/day...

    Stone Energy (SGY +1.6%) says production guidance for Q1 remains within 230M-240M cfe/day despite curtailments in Appalachia; since most of the curtailment was natural gas, SGY expects liquids to represent ~50% of overall volumes. SGY secures a deepwater drilling rig for its Cardona oil development program at Mississippi Canyon 29; drilling is expected to begin in H2.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:27 AM
  • EXAM

    ExamWorks (EXAM +7.1%) gets a lift from a price target hike at Credit Suisse. The bank rates the...

    ExamWorks (EXAM +7.1%) gets a lift from a price target hike at Credit Suisse. The bank rates the IME provider's stock outperform and today raised its target from $18 to $21. 

     
     
     
     
    | 11:23 AM
  • AZZ

    Shares of AZZ (AZZ +1%) tick higher today, despite delivering a mixed Q4 report earlier today...

    Shares of AZZ (AZZ +1%) tick higher today, despite delivering a mixed Q4 report earlier today that beat on a per share basis but came up shy on the revenue side. Net earnings rose 14% Y/Y as both its galvanizing services and lighting segments posted double-digit sales increases. Backlog at the quarter's end jumped 60% to $221.7M. The company also raised its FY14 earnings estimate to between $2.65 and $2.95 per share on revenue of $ 825M to $900M. Its January projection was $2.50 to $2.75 a share on revenue of around $625M and $660M.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:17 AM
  • CA

    CA (CA -1.9%) heads south following a downgrade to Neutral from Mizuho, which is worried the...

    CA (CA -1.9%) heads south following a downgrade to Neutral from Mizuho, which is worried the systems management software firm's CEO change could disrupt its product development efforts over the short-term. CA shares have been range-bound over the last 2 months after rallying to start the year. FQ4 results are due on May 7.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:16 AM
  • STP

    Bankrupt Suntech (STP +16.1%) soars on a rumor Berkshire Hathaway's MidAmerican Energy division...

    Bankrupt Suntech (STP +16.1%) soars on a rumor Berkshire Hathaway's MidAmerican Energy division is interested in the company. Though MidAmerican has acquired solar projects and provides installation services, buying a Chinese solar module maker would be off the beaten path.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:00 AM | 3 Comments
  • NVIV

    InVivo Therapeutics (NVIV +6.4%) trades sharply higher after offering to exchange outstanding...

    InVivo Therapeutics (NVIV +6.4%) trades sharply higher after offering to exchange outstanding warrants issued in 2010 for new warrants in connection with the company's intention to list on the NASDAQ or NYSE MKT. The company says the existing warrants would force it to report negative stockholder's equity, effectively precluding an uplist of the shares to a national securities exchange. 

     
     
     
     
    | 10:56 AM | 1 Comment
  • ACRX

    AcelRx Pharmaceuticals (ACRX +3.6%) gets a lift after Jefferies initiates the shares with a Buy...

    AcelRx Pharmaceuticals (ACRX +3.6%) gets a lift after Jefferies initiates the shares with a Buy rating and an $8 price target this morning. Jefferies says it expects FDA approval in 2014 for ACRX's lead product candidate ARX-01, a drug for post-op pain control, in 2014 given the solid body of data from recent tests. The firm notes that the current standard of care for post-op pain control poses hefty barriers to entry, and it is projecting around $400M in peak potential for ARX-01 with minimal threat from generics.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:51 AM
  • GLUU

    Glu Mobile (GLUU +8.5%) is adding to Friday's gains, and is now up 16% over the last 2 trading...

    Glu Mobile (GLUU +8.5%) is adding to Friday's gains, and is now up 16% over the last 2 trading days. Over the weekend, SA contributor Brandon Osborne followed up on his Thursday column on Glu by pointing out the text of a "Change of Control Severance Agreement" Glu recently signed with game studio chief Matthew Ricchetti suggests the company is at least open to buyout offers, and is making contingency plans. Speculation Glu could be an M&A target for Zynga or some other firm has been around for a while.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:42 AM
  • GOL

    Shares of Gol Linhas (GOL +10.3%) fly higher after the company lands a major investor for its...

    Shares of Gol Linhas (GOL +10.3%) fly higher after the company lands a major investor for its Smiles IPO. The carrier wants to raise 1.35B reais ($681M) in the IPO of the customer loyalty business.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:30 AM
  • SDIX

    Strategic Diagnostics (OTC:SDIX +9.7%) sells the assets of its Life Science business to OriGene...

    Strategic Diagnostics (OTC:SDIX +9.7%) sells the assets of its Life Science business to OriGene Technologies for $16M. The sale represents substantially all of the assets of OTC:SDIX and has agreed to offer employment to a substantial majority of SDIX's employees.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:18 AM
  • GRPN

    Alibaba expands its daily deals business to Hong Kong and Taiwan, a move that presents fresh...

    Alibaba expands its daily deals business to Hong Kong and Taiwan, a move that presents fresh competition for Groupon (GRPN -2%). Alibaba already runs the most popular daily deals site in China, under the name of its Taobao e-commerce site, and claims to already have 2M+ registered users in Hong Kong and Taiwan. Groupon opened a concept store in Hong Kong last November.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:15 AM
  • FSLR

    First Solar (FSLR +1.8%) and sales chief James Brown have "mutually agreed" Brown should no...

    First Solar (FSLR +1.8%) and sales chief James Brown have "mutually agreed" Brown should no longer work for the company. The disclosure, which comes in advance of tomorrow's analyst day, doesn't seem to be bothering investors much, as First Solar joins a broader rally in solar names (TAN +1.3%) in the wake of Trina's upbeat comments about industry capacity and Chinese demand. JKS +8.2%. CSUN +8.4%. YGE +4%. SOL +4.7%. SPWR +2.4%. SCTY +1.9%. DQ +6.3%. CSIQ +2.6%. JASO +2.3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:07 AM | 3 Comments
  • EDAC

    Edac Technologies (EDAC -4.5%) falls after saying MidOcean Partners has withdrawn its bid to...

    Edac Technologies (EDAC -4.5%) falls after saying MidOcean Partners has withdrawn its bid to acquire all of Edac's outstanding shares for $18.25. The company recommends stockholders tender their shares to a separate offer from GB Aero Engine for $17.75. 

     
     
     
     
    | 10:03 AM
  • MLCO

    Casino stocks rip higher after Fitch ratings revises its forecast for 2013 Macau casino revenue...

    Casino stocks rip higher after Fitch ratings revises its forecast for 2013 Macau casino revenue higher. The agency see the VIP segment growing at a 4%-5% clip and the mass market segment to rise 20%-25% this year. Melco Crown (MPEL +2.8%) is leading the charge due to its higher concentration in Macau - but MGM Resorts (MGM +1.8%), Wynn Resorts (WYNN +2%), and Las Vegas Sands (LVS +2.3%) are all outperforming as well.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:01 AM | 4 Comments
  • WLL

    Whiting Petroleum (WLL +2.4%) is upgraded to Overweight from Neutral at J.P. Morgan, which notes...

    Whiting Petroleum (WLL +2.4%) is upgraded to Overweight from Neutral at J.P. Morgan, which notes WLL is trading at a discount on both a NAV and multiples basis with potential near-term catalysts in testing the higher-density pilot programs in the Williston Basin, the Niobrara (Redtail), the horizontal Red River concepts, and the Hz prospects in the Permian (Big Tex).

     
     
     
     
    | 9:59 AM
  • RBCN

    An upgrade to Buy from Sterne Agee leads Rubicon (RBCN +7.8%) to jump out of the gate. LED...

    An upgrade to Buy from Sterne Agee leads Rubicon (RBCN +7.8%) to jump out of the gate. LED equipment supplier GT Advanced (GTAT +1.3%) is also trading higher. 25.2% of Rubicon's float was shorted as of March 15; shares have rallied strongly since early March after crashing in February.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:51 AM
  • CRNT

    Ceragon (CRNT -5.9%) warns it expects to report Q1 revenue of $89M-$91M and EPS of -$0.15 to...

    Ceragon (CRNT -5.9%) warns it expects to report Q1 revenue of $89M-$91M and EPS of -$0.15 to -$0.18, below a consensus of $101.7M and $0.02. The mobile backhaul equipment maker says it's "taking longer than we expected to close certain deals," due to the "cautious approach" of carriers. Though Ceragon expects Q2 bookings to improve a bit thanks to seasonality, it sees "longer sales cycles" persisting. Ceragon and rival DragonWave (DRWI -2.5%) appear to be losing share to larger mobile infrastructure providers. (DragonWave's FQ4 warning)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:34 AM
  • UNXL

    UniPixel (NASDAQ:UNXL) +17% after announcing a partnership with a "major touchscreen ecosystem...

    UniPixel (NASDAQ:UNXL) +17% after announcing a partnership with a "major touchscreen ecosystem partner" to develop/produce touchscreens using its UniBoss touch sensor film. A "preferred price and capacity license" has been given to the partner, which will use it to create 1M square feet/month of capacity, bringing the total "license capacity" for UniBoss to 2M square feet/month. UniPixel adds it has received an initial $5M payment from its existing PC OEM licensee, which it will recognize in Q1 results.
